parse.title: List of Grammy Award winners and nominees by country

German[edit]

The following is a list of Grammy Awards winners and nominees from Germany:

Year Category Nominee(s) Nominated for Result
1982 Best Rock Instrumental Performance Kraftwerk[7] "Computer World"[8] Nominated
1990 Best New Artist Milli Vanilli Milli Vanilli[9] Won (revoked[10])
2006 Best Electronic/Dance Album Kraftwerk Minimum-Maximum[11] Nominated
2014 Lifetime Achievement Award Kraftwerk[12] Won
2018 Best Electronic/Dance Album 3-D The Catalogue[13] Won
Best Surround Sound Album Fritz Hilpert, Tom Ammermann for 3-D The Catalogue[14] Nominated

The following is a list of Grammy Awards winners and nominees from Taiwan:

Year Category Nominees(s) Nominated for Result
2005 Best Recording Package Ching-Yang Hsiao[18] The Wandering Accordion Nominated
2008 White Horse Nominated
2009 Best Boxed or Special Limited Edition Package Wu Sheng: Poems& Songs Nominated
2010 Best Recording Package Story Island Nominated

Notes[edit]

  1. ^ Franghiz Alizadeh and Alim Qasimov[4] were two members of a large musical collective, who performed on the album.
  2. ^ As a member of the Pat Metheny Group
  3. ^ Rabih Abou Khalil [15] was a member of a large musical collective, who performed on the album.
  4. ^ Ganbaataryn Khongorzul, Byambasuren Sharav and Sangidorjiin Sansargereltekh [16] were members of a large musical collective, who performed on the album.
  5. ^ Hussain Jiffry was the bass player, who performed on Alpert's 2013 album, Steppin' Out.

  8. ^ "24th Annual Grammy Awards Final Nominations". Billboard. 94 (3): 90. 23 January 1982. ISSN 0006-2510. Retrieved 1 May 2014. 
  9. ^ "Grammys reach out to young listeners". Lodi News-Sentinel. February 21, 1990. Retrieved 24 April 2010. 
  10. ^ Philips, Chuck (20 November 1990). "Milli Vanilli's Grammy Rescinded by Academy : Music: Organization revokes an award for the first time after revelation that the duo never sang on album". Los Angeles Times. 
  11. ^ "BBC NEWS | Entertainment | Grammy Awards 2006: Key winners". BBC News. 9 February 2006. Retrieved 2 July 2015. 
  12. ^ "Lifetime Achievement Award for Kraftwerk | Music | DW | 24.01.2014". DW News. 24 January 2014. Retrieved 25 February 2018. 
  13. ^ "Kraftwerk win Grammy Award for best electronic album | News | DW News | 29.01.2018". DW News. 29 January 2018. Retrieved 25 February 2018.
